sentence: In a mighty kingdom, a craving Celestial bearer of renown faced an ordeal.
original: In a mighty kingdom, a craving Celestial bearer of renown faced an ordeal.
translation: 在一个强大的王国里，一位声名显赫的天界持有者面临着一场考验。
phonetic: [ɪn ə ˈmaɪti ˈkɪŋdəm ə ˈkreɪvɪŋ səˈlɛstʃəl ˈbɛrər əv rɪˈnaʊn feɪst ən ɔːrˈdiːl]

sentence: Stripped of humility, he seized the insatiable lust for power, forsook his doctrines, and yearned to conquer mortal realms.
original: Stripped of humility, he seized the insatiable lust for power, forsook his doctrines, and yearned to conquer mortal realms.
translation: 失去了谦卑，他抓住了那难以满足的权力欲望，抛弃了他的教义，并渴望征服凡人的领域。
phonetic: [strɪpt əv hjuːˈmɪlɪti hiː siːzd ðiː ɪnˈseɪʃəbəl lʌst fɔː ˈpaʊər fərˈsuːk hɪz ˈdɒktrɪnz ənd jɜːnd tə ˈkɒŋkər ˈmɔːtəl rɛlmz]

sentence: His untamed desires forged a burden he bore alone, woven with misfortune and folly.
original: His untamed desires forged a burden he bore alone, woven with misfortune and folly.
translation: 他那不羁的欲望锻造了一个他独自承受的负担，这个负担交织着不幸与愚行。
phonetic: [hɪz ˈʌnˈteɪmd dɪˈzaɪərz fɔːdʒd ə ˈbɜːdən hiː bɔːr əˈloʊn ˈwoʊvən wɪð ˈmɪsfɔːrtʃən ənd ˈfɒli]

sentence: Destined to rule, his strive for everlasting charm ruined his successor and left him fuming with rage.
original: Destined to rule, his strive for everlasting charm ruined his successor and left him fuming with rage.
translation: 注定要统治，他对永恒魅力的追求毁了他的继承者，令他在愤怒中咆哮。
phonetic: [ˈdɛstɪnd tə ruːl hɪz straɪv fɔː ˈɛvəˈlæstɪŋ tʃɑːm ˈruːɪnd hɪz səkˈsɛsər ənd lɛft hɪm ˈfjuːmɪŋ wɪð reɪdʒ]

sentence: Shrouded in scandals, his obsession lingered like echoes of a bastard's harsh deeds, until perils brought him down, leaving a relic of a once resolute ruler.
original: Shrouded in scandals, his obsession lingered like echoes of a bastard's harsh deeds, until perils brought him down, leaving a relic of a once resolute ruler.
translation: 被丑闻笼罩着，他的执念如同私生子的残酷行为的回声般挥之不去，直到种种危险将他击倒，留下了一个曾经坚决统治者的遗物。
phonetic: [ˈʃraʊdɪd ɪn ˈskændəlz hɪz əbˈsɛʃən ˈlɪŋɡəd laɪk ˈɛkoʊz əv ə ˈbæstərdz hɑːrʃ diːdz ənˈtɪl ˈpɛrəlz brɔːt hɪm daʊn ˈliːvɪŋ ə ˈrɛlɪk əv ə wʌns rɪˈzɒljʊt ˈruːlər]

sentence: Since his early days, he'd always had an eye for the finer things and a will to wrest them from others.
original: Since his early days, he'd always had an eye for the finer things and a will to wrest them from others.
translation: 自从他早年起，他就总是对精美的事物有敏锐的眼光，并且有意图从他人那里夺取这些东西。
phonetic: [sɪns hɪz ˈɜːrli deɪz hiːd ˈɔːlweɪz hæd ən aɪ fɔːr ðə ˈfaɪnər θɪŋz ænd ə wɪl tə rɛst ðəm frəm ˈʌðərz]

sentence: He laid his eyes on them, craving to seize their riches, no better than the black bear and ginger. I say you can't have an eye for the finer things while the Buddha oversees the three Realms.
original: He laid his eyes on them, craving to seize their riches, no better than the black bear and JinChi. I say you can't have an eye for the finer things while the Buddha oversees the three realms.
translation: 他盯上了它们，渴望夺取它们的财富，不比黑熊和生姜好多少。我说，在佛陀监督三界的时候，你无法对精美的事物有所贪念。
phonetic: [hiː leɪd hɪz aɪz ɒn ðɛm ˈkreɪvɪŋ tə siːz ðɛər ˈrɪʧɪz nəʊ ˈbɛtər ðæn ðə blæk beər ænd ˈʤɪnʤər. aɪ seɪ juː kænt hæv ən aɪ fɔːr ðə ˈfaɪnər θɪŋz waɪl ðə ˈbʊdə ˈoʊvərsiːz ðə θriː reɪlmz]

sentence: Well, I hardly think that's fair. How insatiable he was! He wasn't content with his kingdom and title below, so he asked for a position in the Celestial Court.
original: Well, I hardly think that's fair. How insatiable he was! He wasn't content with his kingdom and title below, so he asked for a position in the celestial court.
translation: 嗯，我不认为那公平。他是多么贪得无厌！他对自己的王国和地位并不满足，所以他请求在天庭得到一个职位。
phonetic: [wɛl aɪ ˈhɑːrdli θɪŋk ðæts fɛər. haʊ ɪnˈseɪʃəbl hiː wəz hiː wəznt kənˈtɛnt wɪð hɪz ˈkɪŋdəm ænd ˈtaɪtl bɪˈloʊ, soʊ hiː ɑːskt fɔːr ə pəˈzɪʃən ɪn ðə səˈlɛstɪəl kɔːrt]

sentence: But soon after his wish was granted, his joy turned to rage, all because he wasn't invited to a feast. He nearly ruined the entire Celestial Palace, his ears fuming at unfavorable news, as untamed and ungrateful as that yellow rat.
original: But soon after his wish was granted, his joy turned to rage, all because he wasn't invited to a feast. He nearly ruined the entire celestial palace, his ears fuming at unfavorable news, as untamed and ungrateful as that yellow rat.
translation: 但他的愿望被实现后不久，他的喜悦变成了愤怒，这都是因为他没被邀请参加宴会。他几乎毁了整个天宫，他的耳朵因不利消息而冒火，就像那只黄鼠一样野蛮和忘恩负义。
phonetic: [bʌt suːn ˈɑːftər hɪz wɪʃ wəz ˈgræntɪd hɪz ʤɔɪ tɜːrnd tə reɪʤ ɔːl bɪˈkɔːz hiː wəznt ɪnˈvaɪtɪd tə ə fiːst hiː ˈnɪərli ˈruːɪnd ði ɪnˈtaɪər səˈlɛstɪəl ˈpælɪs hɪz ɪərz ˈfjumɪŋ æt ənˈfeɪvərəbl nuːz æz ənˈteɪmd ænd ənˈgreɪtfəl æz ðæt ˈjɛloʊ ræt]

sentence: Beasts are beasts, don't you think? He was young and didn't know any better, as he hadn't learned from the Buddha or our Master yet. Aren't you being a bit harsh dredging up the scandals from his youth?
original: Beasts are beasts, don't you think? He was young and didn't know any better, as he hadn't learned from the Buddha or our Master yet. Aren't you being a bit harsh dredging up the scandals from his youth?
translation: 野兽就是野兽，不是吗？他年轻，不懂得什么是好坏，因为他还没从佛陀或我们师父那里学到教训。你不觉得翻他年轻时的旧账有点苛刻吗？
phonetic: [bists ɑr bists doʊnt ju θɪŋk hi wəz jʌŋ ænd dɪdnt noʊ ɛni bɛtər æz hi hædənt lɜrnd frʌm ðə bʊdə ɔr ʌr mæstər jɛt arent ju biɪŋ ə bɪt hɑrʃ drɛʤɪŋ ʌp ðə skændəlz frʌm hɪz juθ]

sentence: But it's not like his adulthood was any better. Since his release, he claimed to have learned manners and discipline, yet his wee prank in CheChi gave him away.
original: But it's not like his adulthood was any better. Since his release, he claimed to have learned manners and discipline, yet his wee prank  in CheChi gave him away.
translation: 但他的成年生活也没好到哪去。自从他被释放以来，他声称自己学会了礼仪和纪律，但他那虚弱的焚香暴露了他的真实状态。
phonetic: [bʌt ɪts nɒt laɪk hɪz əˈdʌlthʊd wəz ˈɛni ˈbɛtər sɪns hɪz rɪˈliːs hiː kleɪmd tə həv lɜrnd ˈmænərz ænd ˈdɪsɪplɪn jɛt hɪz wiːk ˈfræŋkɪnsɛns geɪv hɪm əˈweɪ]

sentence: He posed as an idol, degrading the God, and his defiance of the doctrines he learned was clear. Well, he was just being naughty. Aren't all great achievers somewhat self-obsessed, with noses in the air, feeling above others?
original: He posed as an idol, degrading the god, Clear was defiance of the doctrines he learned was learned. Well, he was just being naughty. Aren't all great achievers somewhat self-obsessed, with noses in the air, feeling above others?
translation: 他装作一个偶像，贬低了神，他对所学教义的蔑视显而易见。嗯，他只是在耍坏。所有伟大的成就者不都是有点自我迷恋吗？鼻子翘得高高的，觉得比别人高人一等。
phonetic: [hiː poʊzd æz ən ˈaɪdəl dɪˈgreɪdɪŋ ðə gɒd ænd hɪz dɪˈfaɪəns ʌv ðə ˈdɒktrɪnz hiː lɜrnd wəz klɪər wɛl hiː wəz ʤʌst biːɪŋ ˈnɔːti arent ɔl greɪt əˈʧiːvərz ˈsʌmwɒt sɛlf-əbˈsɛst wɪð ˈnoʊzɪz ɪn ðə ɛr ˈfiːlɪŋ əˈbʌv ˈʌðərz]

sentence: I say he was no less insolent than that yellow-brow brat. Wait, isn't it that lady of some sort? It was her tricks that made Master drive Wukong away on White Tiger Ridge.
original: I say he was no less insolent than that yellow-brow brat. Wait, isn't it that lady of some sort? It was her tricks that made Master drive Wukong away on White Tiger Ridge.
translation: 我说他和那个黄眉小子一样无礼。等一下，不就是那个女人吗？是她的诡计让师父把悟空赶到了白虎岭。
phonetic: [aɪ seɪ hiː wəz noʊ lɛs ˈɪnsələnt ðæn ðæt ˈjɛloʊ braʊ bræt weɪt ɪznt ɪt ðæt ˈleɪdi ʌv sʌm sɔrt ɪt wəz hɜr trɪks ðæt meɪd ˈmæstər draɪv wuːˈkɔŋ əˈweɪ ɒn waɪt ˈtaɪgə rɪʤ]

sentence: He forsook his love three times, breaking her into pieces and convincing himself his heart would ache no more. Yet, as you must know, he had never let go of her.
original: He forsook his love three times, breaking her into pieces and convincing himself his heart would ache no more. Yet, as you must know, he had never let go of her.
translation: 他三次抛弃了他的爱人，把她打成碎片，并说服自己他的心不会再痛了。然而，你一定知道，他从未真正放下她。
phonetic: [hiː fəˈsʊk hɪz lʌv θriː taɪmz ˈbreɪkɪŋ hɜr ˈɪntə ˈpiːsɪz ænd kənˈvɪnsɪŋ hɪmˈsɛlf hɪz hɑrt wʊd eɪk noʊ mɔr jɛt æz juː mʌst noʊ hiː həd ˈnɛvər lɛt goʊ ʌv hɜr]

sentence: Otherwise, he wouldn't have been so eager to get away from the Buddhahood he attained. Those who talk much of love will one day bite their tongues. On this matter, he was akin to you and your many darlings.
original: Otherwise, he wouldn't have been so eager to get away from the Buddhahood he attained. Those who talk much of love will one day bite their tongues. On this matter, he was akin to you and your many darlings.
translation: 否则，他就不会那么迫切地想逃离他所获得的佛位了。那些常谈论爱情的人有一天会咬自己的舌头。在这一点上，他和你及你的许多情人相似。
phonetic: [ˈʌðərˌwaɪz hiː wʊdənt hæv bɪn soʊ ˈigər tə gɛt əˈweɪ frʌm ðə ˈbʊdəˌhʊd hi əˈteɪnd ðoʊz hu tɔk mʌʧ ʌv lʌv wɪl wʌn deɪ baɪt ðɛər tʌŋz ɒn ðɪs ˈmætər hi wəz əˈkɪn tə ju ænd jʊər ˈmɛni ˈdɑrlɪŋz]

sentence: No matter where you are, you'd always fall captive to the web of mortal desire. Why bring me into this? True, I don't have the will to break the web, but he had torn his way out since that day.
original: No matter where you are, you'd always fall captive to the web of mortal desire. Why bring me into this? True, I don't have the will to break the web, but he had torn his way out since that day.
translation: 无论你在哪里，你总是被尘世的欲望之网所俘虏。为什么把我拉进这件事里？确实，我没有打破欲望之网的意志，但他从那天起已经冲破了它。
phonetic: [noʊ ˈmætər wɛr ju ɑr juːd ˈɔlweɪz fɔl ˈkæptɪv tə ðə wɛb ʌv ˈmɔrtəl dɪˈzaɪər waɪ brɪŋ mi ˈɪntu ðɪs tru aɪ doʊnt hæv ðə wɪl tə breɪk ðə wɛb bət hi hæd tɔrn hɪz weɪ aʊt sɪns ðæt deɪ]

sentence: Take a look, bearer, can you see? Many of your good friends are here. We're just fair-weather friends, that's all. But they are still friends, aren't they? So you say, so it must be.
original: Take a look, bearer, can you see? Many of your good friends are here. We're just fair-weather friends, that's all. But they are still friends, aren't they? So you say, so it must be.
translation: 看看吧，持有人，你看见了吗？你的许多好朋友都在这里。我们只是顺境的朋友，仅此而已。但他们还是朋友，不是吗？你这么说，所以肯定是这样。
phonetic: [teɪk ə lʊk ˈbɛrər kæn ju siː ˈmɛni ʌv jʊər gʊd frɛndz ɑr hɪər wi ər ʤʌst ˈfɛrˌwɛðər frɛndz ðæts ɔːl bʌt ðeɪ ɑr stɪl frɛndz ɑrnt ðeɪ soʊ ju seɪ soʊ ɪt mʌst bi]

sentence: These old buddies, I think none of them ended up well. Indeed, for ages, countless gifted souls have walked this earth, yet how few have forged everlasting greatness.
original: These old buddies, I think none of them ended up well. Indeed, for ages, countless gifted souls have walked this earth, yet how few have forged everlasting greatness.
translation: 这些老朋友，我觉得他们都没什么好结果。确实，千百年来，无数天才灵魂走过这片大地，但其中有多少人锻造出了永恒的伟大呢？
phonetic: [ðiz oʊld ˈbʌdiz aɪ θɪŋk nʌn ʌv ðɛm ɛndəd ʌp wɛl ɪnˈdid fɔr eɪʤəz ˈkaʊntlɪs ˈgɪftɪd soʊlz hæv wɔkt ðɪs ərθ jɛt haʊ fjuː hæv fɔrʤd ˌɛvərˈlæstɪŋ ˈgreɪtnəs]

sentence: Do you know why? Injustice. Never has it been just misfortune. Fortune is simply humility, and the mighty, well, perhaps they simply lacked my charm.
original: Do you know why? Injustice. Never has it been just misfortune. Fortune is simply humility, and the mighty, well, perhaps they simply lacked my charm.
translation: 你知道为什么吗？因为不公。它从来不仅仅是厄运。幸运只不过是谦卑，而那些强者呢，或许他们只是缺少了我的魅力。
phonetic: [dʊ jʊ noʊ waɪ ɪnˈʤʌstɪs ˈnɛvər hæz ɪt bɪn ʤʌst ˌmɪsˈfɔrʧən ˈfɔrʧən ɪz ˈsɪmpli hjuˈmɪlɪti ænd ðə ˈmaɪti wɛl pərˈhæps ðeɪ ˈsɪmpli lækt maɪ ʧɑrm]

sentence: They may be gifted, yet they don't strive. Content with little and lost in lust, they seek ease yet crave renown. They yearn for freedom, yet aspire to Buddhahood.
original: Gifted they maybe, yet  strive they not . Content with little and lost in lust,  seek ease yet crave renown. They yearn for freedom, yet aspire to Buddhahood.
translation: 他们或许天赋异禀，但他们并不努力。他们满足于少量的东西，却迷失在欲望中，他们追求安逸，却渴望名望。他们渴望自由，却又向往成佛。
phonetic: [ðeɪ meɪ biː ˈgɪftɪd jɛt ðeɪ doʊnt straɪv kənˈtɛnt wɪð ˈlɪtl ænd lɒst ɪn lʌst ðeɪ siːk iːz jɛt kreɪv rɪˈnaʊn ðeɪ jɜrn fɔr ˈfriːdəm jɛt əˈspaɪər tu ˈbʊdəˌhʊd]

sentence: They always want both, but nobody can, and nobody should. Such was the folly of the Bull King and Wukong. Destiny's favor calls for the resolution to sever all desires.
original: They always want both, but nobody can, and nobody should. Such was the folly of the Bull King and Wukong. Destiny's favor calls for the resolution to sever all desires.
translation: 他们总是想要两者，但没有人可以，也没有人应该。这就是牛魔王和悟空的愚蠢之处。命运的青睐需要下定决心断绝一切欲望。
phonetic: [ðeɪ ˈɔːlweɪz wɑːnt boʊθ bət ˈnoʊbədi kæn ænd ˈnoʊbədi ʃʊd ˈsʌʧ wəz ðə ˈfɒli ʌv ðə bʊl kɪŋ ænd ˈwuːˈkɔŋ ˈdɛstɪniz ˈfeɪvər kɔlz fɔr ðə ˌrɛzəˈluːʃən tə ˈsɛvər ɔːl dɪˈzaɪərz]

sentence: Five of the six relics call for one: ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind. Mind, it's mind. What did you just see? The three of us, that was the last one.
original: Five of the six relics call for one: ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind. Mind, it's mind. What did you just see? The three of us, that was the last one.
translation: 六个圣物中的五个都指向一个：耳朵、鼻子、舌头、身体和心灵。心灵，就是心灵。你刚才看到了什么？我们三个人，那是最后一个。
phonetic: [faɪv ʌv ðə sɪks ˈrɛlɪks kɔːl fɔːr wʌn ɪər noʊz tʌŋ bɒdi ænd maɪnd maɪnd ɪts maɪnd wɒt dɪd juː dʒʌst siː ðə θriː ʌv ʌs ðæt wəz ðə læst wʌn]

sentence: Though ages have passed, it maintains a connection attuned to the echoes of his former self. If you truly are the one destined, you must cast aside his soulless shell and merge the six into one.
original: Though ages have passed, it maintains a connection attuned to the echoes of his former self. If you truly are the one destined, you must cast aside his soulless shell and merge the six into one.
translation: 尽管岁月流逝，它仍与他过去的自己保持着一种契合的联系。如果你真的是命中注定的那个人，你必须抛弃他那无魂的躯壳，将六感合为一体。
phonetic: [ðoʊ eɪʤəz hæv pæst ɪt meɪnˈteɪnz ə kəˈnɛkʃən əˈtund tuː ði ˈɛkoʊz ʌv hɪz ˈfɔrmər sɛlf ɪf ju ˈtruːli ɑr ðə wʌn ˈdɛstɪnd ju mʌst kæst əˈsaɪd hɪz soʊlɪs ʃɛl ænd mɜrʤ ðə sɪks ˈɪntu wʌn]

sentence: Then you shall be the one to begin the journey anew. No, not on his own. He's just a kid who knows nothing, but I'll go with him.
original: Then you shall be the one to begin the journey anew. No, not on his own. He's just a kid who knows nothing, but I'll go with him.
translation: 然后你将成为那个重新开始旅程的人。不，不是他一个人。他只是个什么都不懂的孩子，但我会和他一起去。
phonetic: [ðɛn ju ʃæl bi ðə wʌn tu bɪˈgɪn ðə ˈʤɜrni əˈnju noʊ nɒt ɒn hɪz oʊn hɪz ʤʌst ə kɪd hu noʊz ˈnʌθɪŋ bʌt aɪl ɡoʊ wɪð hɪm]

sentence: This place is shaped by Wukong's lingering obsession. It allows only his relic bearer to face the final ordeal. We can escort him no more. See it for yourself.
original: This place is shaped by Wukong's lingering obsession. It allows only his relic bearer to face the final ordeal. We can escort him no more. See it for yourself.
translation: 这个地方是由悟空挥之不去的执念塑造的。它只允许他的圣物持有者面对最后的考验。我们不能再护送他了。自己看看吧。
phonetic: [ðɪs pleɪs ɪz ʃeɪpt baɪ wuːˈkɔŋz ˈlɪŋərɪŋ əbˈsɛʃən ɪt əˈlaʊz ˈoʊnli hɪz ˈrɛlɪk ˈbɛərər tə feɪs ðə ˈfaɪnl ɔrˈdiːəl wi kæn ɪsˈkɔrt hɪm noʊ mɔr si ɪt fɔːr jɔːˈsɛlf]

sentence: You must have heard tales about him. Some say he helped Tang Monk fetch the scriptures, was granted Buddhahood, and stayed on Mount Lingtai thereafter.
original: You must have heard tales about him. Some say he helped Tang Monk fetch the scriptures, was granted Buddhahood, and stayed on Mount Lingtai thereafter.
translation: 你一定听过他的传说。有人说他帮助唐僧取经，获得了佛位，然后留在了灵台山。
phonetic: [juː mʌst hæv hɜrd teɪlz əˈbaʊt hɪm sʌm seɪ hiː hɛlpt tɑŋ mʌŋk fɛʧ ðə ˈskrɪpʧərz wəz ˈɡræntɪd ˈbʊdəˌhʊd ænd steɪd ɒn maʊnt ˈlɪŋˈtaɪ ðɛərˈæftər]

sentence: Some say it was not him who was granted Buddhahood; the real him was already dead on the journey to the West. Some say that the journey never happened.
original: Some say it was not him who was granted Buddhahood; the real him was already dead on the journey to the West. Some say that the journey never happened.
translation: 有人说获得佛位的不是他；真正的他已经在西行的路上死去了。还有人说，那段旅程根本就没有发生过。
phonetic: [sʌm seɪ ɪt wəz nɒt hɪm hu wəz ˈɡræntɪd ˈbʊdəˌhʊd ðə rɪəl hɪm wəz ɔːlˈrɛdi dɛd ɒn ðə ˈdʒɜːni tuː ðə wɛst sʌm seɪ ðæt ðə ˈdʒɜːni ˈnɛvər ˈhæpənd]

sentence: He is nothing but a monkey who lives in some storyteller's tall tale, but now you will hear a tale which no one has ever known.
original: He is nothing but a monkey who lives in some storyteller's tall tale, but now you will hear a tale which no one has ever known.
translation: 他不过是生活在某个说书人高谈阔论中的一只猴子，但现在你将听到一个从未有人知道的故事。
phonetic: [hiː ɪz ˈnʌθɪŋ bət ə ˈmʌŋki huː lɪvz ɪn sʌm ˈstɔːriˌtɛlərz tɔːl teɪl bʌt naʊ juː wɪl hɪər ə teɪl wɪʧ noʊ wʌn hæz ˈɛvər noʊn]
